titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL933_02
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL933_02

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

Text preserved in this squueze:
1.Biʿathtar, and his sons, of the lineage of ʿ[...] 2.their goddess of protection with the favorable oracle and the aid of ʿAthtar 3.[...], and Shamsum (i.e the goddess of protection), for their well-being and
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.Biʿathtar, and his sons, of the lineage of ʿI[nānān Dhū-Dharaʾān set up the stele of] 2.their goddess of protection with the favorable oracle and the aid of ʿAthtar [Shāriqān and ʾĪlmuquh Lord of the Ib-] 3.exes, and Shamsum (i.e the goddess of protection), for their well-being and [the well-being of their children and their property.]

Text preserved in this squueze:
Biʿathtar, and his sons, of the lineage of ʿ...
their goddess of protection with the favorable oracle and the aid of ʿAthtar
..., and Shamsum i.e the goddess of protection, for their well-being and
Restored full text of the inscription:
Biʿathtar, and his sons, of the lineage of ʿInānān Dhū-Dharaʾān set up the stele of
their goddess of protection with the favorable oracle and the aid of ʿAthtar Shāriqān and ʾĪlmuquh Lord of the Ib-
exes, and Shamsum i.e the goddess of protection, for their well-being and the well-being of their children and their property.
